messages: 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:43): we went through requirements
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:43): nothing really controversial
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:43): friendly group
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:43): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: Did the whole "amateur" thing come up?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:44): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: what's the deal with the mailing list looking like it's full of controversy?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, we haven't gotten to the bad parts yet I think
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:49): whatwg.org seems to be running really slowly today.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:49): even hixie.ch is takes forever to respond.
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:56): nobody here in favor of sentinel framing
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:56): Not that surprsing
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:57): I don't really feel strongly so I didn't comment
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:57): Have they discussed the actual arguments that Hixie put forward?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:57): not really
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:57): "learn to count" was the argument
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (14:57): maybe I should have spoken up
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:58): If they don't have a better argument than that we will reach an impass
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:58): "learn to count" isn't compelling at this stage of implementations getting shipped
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:59): It's not compelling full stop
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:00): A trivial amount of time with google and the string UnicodeDecodeError will show you how common it is to not get encoding/decoding strings right
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:00): "learn to count" is denial
f6244444b462555595b15fa856221dac (15:03): Can you *please* raise your concerns in the IETF chat room?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:04): doesn't have a jabber client that does group stuff
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (15:04): Did someone say "denial"?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:05): I guess it would be easier to ask 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de to channel b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea than to join the not-IRC chat room...
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:06): I raised the concern about impasse
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:06): but that was dismissed
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:06): although it seems relevant
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (15:07): How very surprising
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:07): as someone later told me, but he was not the chair or the AD
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:07): If we dismiss concerns of an impasse we are sure to reach one
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:07): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I channelled b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea but that was not acceptable
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:08): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: not acceptable in the sense that to be heard, one must be present or have an IETF-meeting-compatible Jabber setup?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:09): I think so
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:09): it seemed rather weird to me as the concern about an impasse should concern all
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:09): if you have a google account it's pretty easy
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:13): http://lists.xml.org/archives/xml-dev/201007/msg00089.html
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:14): people are now discussing all the ways you can do length encoding
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:15): Hmm, well I managed to join the room

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:16): worse than Opera IRC
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:16): I am unusually grumpy today :(
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:18): ping me here if you say anything; I'll relay in case it falls through

9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (15:40): So what kind of magic must I do to chrome to get an actual stacktrace in the console?

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (15:44): the queue here just gets longer

2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (16:00): i think it was clear long ago this was not controversial
